intro: Erigeron matthiolifolius, commonly known as the Matthiola-leaved fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features finely divided, silvery-green leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. Erigeron matthiolifolius is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
